programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: Chip and Joanna Gaines own and operate Magnolia Homes, a remodeling and design business in Waco, Texas, and "Fixer Upper" shows the process by which the couple turn dilapidated but potential-rich houses into showplaces that are helping revitalize whole neighborhoods throughout central Texas. Chip manages the construction and realty side of Magnolia and Joanna is the lead designer. They also act as part-time counselors to clients who can't see a structure's beauty beyond the blemishes. Combined, Chip and Joanna save homes that look hopeless, renovating the imperfect, and revealing them as what they were always intended to be.

programme.desc: Townspeople mistake two escaped convicts (Jeremy Northam, Steve Zahn) for a gay couple staging a girls beauty pageant.

programme.title: Blithe Spirit
programme.desc: A married crime novelist finds himself in a tough predicament when an eccentric mystic summons the spirit of his first wife during a séance.

programme.title: The Humans
programme.desc: As a family celebrates Thanksgiving, the loving, tight-knit group tries to hold together in the face of an uncertain future.

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: Raised to be an obstetrician at a Maine orphanage, a young man (Tobey Maguire) leaves to work at a cider mill with a soldier's beloved (Charlize Theron).

programme.title: Empire Records
programme.desc: A frustrated record-store manager (Anthony LaPaglia) dreams of owning the business, then an employee (Rory Cochrane) gambles away his down payment.

programme.title: Obvious Child
programme.desc: An immature, newly unemployed comic (Jenny Slate) must navigate the murky waters of adulthood after her fling with a graduate student (Jake Lacy) results in an unplanned pregnancy.

programme.title: Desperately Seeking Susan
programme.desc: A bored housewife (Rosanna Arquette) with amnesia thinks she is ``Susan,`` a wild woman (Madonna) on the run.

programme.title: Support the Girls
programme.desc: Lisa is the general manager of Double Whammies, a sports bar that features skimpily dressed waitresses. Always nurturing and protective of her staff, she soon faces one trying day that tests her optimism at every turn.

programme.title: Boys and Girls
programme.desc: Two longtime friends (Freddie Prinze Jr., Claire Forlani), each with a string of failed romances, wonder if they should date each other.

programme.title: The Diary of a Teenage Girl
programme.desc: In 1970s San Francisco, a precocious 15-year-old (Bel Powley) embarks on an enthusiastic sexual odyssey, beginning with her mother's current lover (Alexander Skarsgård).

programme.title: The Babysitter
programme.desc: An alluring teenage sitter (Alicia Silverstone) becomes the object of her suburban clients' dreams and obsessions.

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: Raised to be an obstetrician at a Maine orphanage, a young man (Tobey Maguire) leaves to work at a cider mill with a soldier's beloved (Charlize Theron).

programme.title: A Ghost Story
programme.desc: A passionate young couple, unexpectedly separated by a shocking loss, discover an eternal connection and a love that is infinite.

programme.title: Let the Right One In
programme.desc: A lonely misfit (Kåre Hedebrant) finds a soul mate in the form of a vampire child (Lina Leandersson) who recently became his neighbor.

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: Hooked on gambling and hounded by the mob, a professor (James Caan) flees with his girlfriend (Lauren Hutton) to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Hired to tame a rowdy Missouri bar, a Ph.D. bouncer (Patrick Swayze) romances a doctor (Kelly Lynch) and tames the whole town.

programme.title: The Ballad of Lefty Brown
programme.desc: A merciless cowboy sets out on a dangerous journey across the frontier, determined to do whatever it takes to avenge his longtime partner's brutal murder.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
programme.desc: Musketeers (Jeremy Irons, John Malkovich) try to displace corrupt King Louis XIV (Leonardo DiCaprio) with his twin brother, imprisoned in the Bastille.

programme.title: Old Henry
programme.desc: A quiet man and his son take in a wounded stranger near his homestead, along with a bag full of cash. The stranger claims he's a sheriff being pursued by outlaws, but the man can't be sure.

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: The Ballad of Lefty Brown
programme.desc: A merciless cowboy sets out on a dangerous journey across the frontier, determined to do whatever it takes to avenge his longtime partner's brutal murder.

programme.title: Assault on Precinct 13
programme.desc: Cops and convicts join forces to defend a barren police station from a vengeance-seeking street gang.

programme.title: Hitsville: The Making of Motown
programme.desc: Motown Records becomes the most successful label of all time after its formation in 1958 Detroit amid racial tension and the burgeoning civil rights movement.

programme.title: Broken Diamonds
programme.desc: A young writer sees his dream put in jeopardy when he has to take care of his mentally ill sister.

programme.title: The War With Grandpa
programme.desc: Forced to give up his room to his grandfather, a scheming boy devises a series of outrageous pranks in an attempt to make him move out.

programme.title: The Curse of the Jade Scorpion
programme.desc: After making an insurance investigator (Woody Allen) fall for an efficiency expert, a hypnotist forces the guy to steal jewels.

programme.title: Menashe
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of New York's notoriously secretive Hasidic Jewish community, Menashe, a good-hearted but somewhat hapless grocery store clerk, struggles against tradition to keep custody of his only son after his wife passes away.

programme.title: A Genie's Tail
programme.desc: A puppy accidentally awakens two genies, and one of them becomes trapped in the dog's body. As the genie keeps trying to grant wishes for its new master, his powers become much more unpredictable.

programme.title: Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
programme.desc: A young sister (Alexa Vega) and brother encounter mutants and a wild scientist while searching for a device that could destroy Earth.

programme.title: The Cutting Edge
programme.desc: An ex-hockey player (D.B. Sweeney) and a prima donna (Moira Kelly) bicker as paired figure skaters shooting for the Olympics.

programme.title: Shaolin Soccer
programme.desc: A soccer coach persuades a kung-fu master (Stephen Chow) and his former classmates to form a team and play for $1 million.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure
programme.desc: Two dopey dudes (Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter) go back in time to fetch Beethoven, Napoleon and other biggies for a history project.

programme.title: Finding Forrester
programme.desc: While studying at a prep school, an aspiring writer (Rob Brown) befriends a reclusive author (Sean Connery) who becomes his mentor.

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: A strong-willed woman (Shirley MacLaine) and her equally independent daughter (Debra Winger) keep the lines of communication open as each deals with the curveballs life throws at them.

programme.title: The Farewell
programme.desc: Billi's family returns to China under the guise of a fake wedding to stealthily say goodbye to their beloved matriarch -- the only person that doesn't know she only has a few weeks to live.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing: Havana Nights
programme.desc: Love blossoms between a young Cuban (Diego Luna) and an American teenager (Romola Garai) as they prepare for a New Year's Eve dance contest.

programme.title: Lee Daniels' The Butler
programme.desc: A White House butler (Forest Whitaker) has a front-row seat to history through three decades and seven presidential administrations, including those of Eisenhower, Kennedy and Nixon (John Cusack).

programme.title: Stray
programme.desc: A detective teams up with an orphaned teen to battle a supernatural force that threatens the city.

programme.title: A Genie's Tail
programme.desc: A puppy accidentally awakens two genies, and one of them becomes trapped in the dog's body. As the genie keeps trying to grant wishes for its new master, his powers become much more unpredictable.

programme.title: Dean Smith
programme.desc: The life of the college basketball coach who retired with the most wins in college basketball history.

programme.title: Love Story
programme.desc: An old-money Harvard man Oliver (Ryan O'Neal) woos and weds a no-money music student (Ali MacGraw) from the wrong side of the tracks.

programme.title: Ice Girls
programme.desc: A 15-year-old figure skating champion leaves the sport after her mother loses her job and the family moves to a small town. She struggles to fit in until the owner of a local skating arena helps her fulfill her true potential.

programme.title: Spy Kids
programme.desc: When a technical genius kidnaps retired spies (Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino), only their children can save them.

programme.title: The Man Who Invented Christmas
programme.desc: Using real-life inspiration and his vivid imagination, author Charles Dickens brings Ebenezer Scrooge, Tiny Tim and other classic characters to life in ``A Christmas Carol,`` forever changing the holiday season into the celebration known today.

programme.title: Big Stone Gap
programme.desc: A long-buried family secret disrupts the quiet life of a single, middle-aged woman (Ashley Judd) in 1978 Virginia.

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: Belgian sleuth Hercule Poirot investigates an American industrialist's murder aboard the world-famous luxury train.

programme.title: Kinky Boots
programme.desc: A fortuitous encounter with a transvestite cabaret singer (Chiwetel Ejiofor) inspires a young man (Joel Edgerton) to save an inherited shoe factory by producing erotic footwear.

programme.title: Mirror Mirror
programme.desc: Saved from death by a band of diminutive highway robbers, an exiled princess (Lily Collins) vows to win back her kingdom from an evil queen (Julia Roberts).

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: A slain Manhattan yuppie (Patrick Swayze) reaches out to his lover (Demi Moore), with a medium (Whoopi Goldberg) as his middlewoman.

programme.title: Broken Diamonds
programme.desc: A young writer sees his dream put in jeopardy when he has to take care of his mentally ill sister.

programme.title: A Call to Spy
programme.desc: At the dawn of World War II, a desperate Winston Churchill orders his new spy agency to train women for covert operations. Together, these female agents help undermine the Nazi regime in France, leaving an unmistakable legacy in their wake.

programme.title: Senior Moment
programme.desc: After drag racing his vintage convertible around Palm Springs, Calif., a retired NASA test pilot loses his license. Forced to take public transportation, he meets Caroline and learns to navigate love and life again.

programme.title: Love Story
programme.desc: An old-money Harvard man Oliver (Ryan O'Neal) woos and weds a no-money music student (Ali MacGraw) from the wrong side of the tracks.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley travels across two of the most enigmatic countries in the Caribbean - Cuba and Haiti. Joanna kicks off her adventure in the back of a classic car in Havana, outlining her 1500-mile Caribbean adventure.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: In the depths of winter, the off-grid Alaskans work tirelessly to combat the deep cold.

programme.title: Spy in the Wild
programme.desc: The Spy Creatures travel to the lands of ice and snow beyond the Arctic and Antarctic circles, observing the hardiest and most charismatic animals in the polar world.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A bull terrier puppy needs a 3D-printed implant for a new lease of life. A Siamese cat has multiple injuries after being hit by a van. And a beloved collie cross, needs a new hip.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti

programme.title: Animal Impossible
programme.desc: Tim and Adam travel to Wyoming to discover if bulls are angered by the colour red. It turns out that they can't see red and that it's movement that they react to. They test this out by Tim standing stationary in a red onesie with a bull in pen and he's not attacked.

programme.title: The Ganges with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: Sue travels from the sacred summit of Shivling, source of the Ganges, to the beautiful mountain town of Rishikesh. Along the way, she meets Hindu holy men known as sadhus, wealthy tycoons and local families to find out what the future holds for this great river.

programme.title: A Perfect Planet
programme.desc: Weather controls the distribution of freshwater around our planet. In turn, shapes the lives of animals across the globe, rising to an incredible diversity of species and habitats.

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred's Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon, Gino and Fred reconvene to rediscover the spirit of Christmas, heading to the unlikely festive destination of Morocco to see what the North African country has to offer.

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: It's Dessert Day and the first heat of junior bakers are asked to make an animal-shaped dessert with ultimate height and jiggle for the Technical, and decorative trifles for the Showstopper.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: This quarter-final sees the strongest four chefs from heats three and four prepare a dish based around mustard. Then they must cook for critics Grace Dent, Tom Parker Bowles and William Sitwell.

programme.title: Recipes That Made Me
programme.desc: Nisha Katona meets home cooks inspired by recipes from Pakistan-administered Kashmir. She discovers fragrant spice blends and family recipes for lamb seekh kebabs and okra curry.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Cape Town, South Africa is home to twenty types of frogs, but many are threatened by urban development. Meet a variety of the region's species as we follow western leopard toads on their tenuous journey to breed in the city's shrinking wetlands.

programme.title: Big Cat Country
programme.desc: Witness an explosive showdown between the all-female Hollywood pride and the Nomad brothers. Then check on Surabi, an MK female gored during a buffalo hunt, and Spotty, an MK cub whose fate hangs in the balance after he's separated from his pride.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: Dogs around the world come to the rescue in surprising ways. Some search for survivors when disaster strikes or rescue animals from poachers and wildlife traffickers. Others help us in times of trouble-both on land and in the water.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: Meet a border collie that protects aircraft from lethal bird strikes, a sprocker spaniel whose sense of smell is saving imperilled water voles, and an Anatolian shepherd that helps conserve Africa's most endangered big cat, the cheetah.

programme.desc: Thirst for rain alongside the animals of the Kalahari, as they endure a brutally dry year. Witness co-operation between elephant herds in their desperate search for water and meet a meerkat's strange babysitter, who helps the next generation survive.

programme.title: The Accidental Wilderness: Europe's Everglades
programme.desc: Marvel at the stunning conversion of a bleak waste-water dumping ground into a paradise for Europe's birds. Travel to western Germany for an intimate look at this reclamation success story, and see the thriving animal communities that live there.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Witness animals struggling with their own kind over the choicest real estate. Learn to fight dirty with a guanaco, head-butt a fellow iguana to claim a piece of prime territory, and meet a hermit crab who forcibly evicts a tenant from its shell.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Witness Lewa's efforts to stop the illegal ivory trade, from building small armies and fending off poachers to educating local communities about the benefits of protecting elephants.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: One beach is man-made and filled with tourists (hello, Miami). Another is well-protected and home to sea turtles (that's Sebastian Island). In this deep-dive into the Florida coastline, understand how beaches are preserved, protected and even profitable.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Experience the ultimate animal battleground as monstrous Komodo dragons fight using prehistoric strength. Flip rivals off trees with a beetle built to bash, start a street fight with a macaque over a wrong glance, and ride on a green sea turtle.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Explore a land of big horns, huge claws, flowing manes, and dance moves that could cut a dozen rugs. Smash skulls with bighorn rams, fight over lunch with a hungry bear, go hoof-to-hoof with wild stallions, and get a dance floor bloody with a grouse.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Referee savage battles for dominance from the Scottish Highlands to the Alps. Chase rivals with a bleating red deer buck, keep intruders at bay with a wolf pack, join a red fox's deadly dance, and steal a neighbour's home with a nasty alpine marmot.

programme.title: Wild Castles
programme.desc: Explore beautiful Heidelberg Castle whose ruins stand in imposing wonder beside the river Neckar in Western Germany. Surrounded by a protected nature reserve, the castle is home to birds of prey and acts as a spawning ground for nearby amphibians.

programme.title: Wild Castles
programme.desc: Travel to a centuries-old French fortress, home to some of history's greatest empires. Carcassone, once a centre of wealth and culture, is now a haven for wildlife. Birds, wild boar, and armies of insects endure in its bountiful surroundings.

programme.title: America's Wild Seasons
programme.desc: It's spring: the season of courtship and new life. Witness nature awaken from its slumber in many forms, from the blossoms that explode in the rain-soaked desert of Arizona to the fuzzy wood ducklings that leap from their nests.

programme.title: Surviving The Amazon
programme.desc: Every year, more than 200,000 monkeys in Peru are trafficked illegally. Almost all are babies. Watch as these little ones learn to survive without their moms and try to make new friends along the way.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: As the dry season approaches, tensions rise on Lemur Island, both between rival gangs and within their own ranks. Get a view from the battlefield as the female leaders fiercely defend their turf, while their newborn infants cling to them for safety.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: As food and water become scarce, Crystal, the fierce leader of the Ruins gang, sets her sights on rival Kati's territory and its neighbouring fruit trees. Watch as Crystal's move and a raid by outside invaders lead to dire consequences for one troop.

programme.title: Gangs Of Lemur Island
programme.desc: The drought is finally over, but traversing the forest for food is still a gamble. See some leaders take the risk, leaving home territories undefended to feast on a cicada boom. When they return, trespassers are ready for a fight.

programme.title: Land of Gremlins
programme.desc: Follow a family of indris, some of the world's largest lemurs, on their daily quest through the rainforest to find food and escape predators. See how these endangered primates survive against all odds in a rapidly shrinking habitat.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Follow penguins, iguanas, tortoises, frogs, and tamarins from Mexico to Peru and as far west as the Galapagos Islands as they live out their daily dramas, affected by the sun's heat, looming predators, and hazardous weather conditions.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Learn the clever ways animals avoid becoming a meal in a deadly land where everything is on the menu. Meet a fish designed to fail, fight crazed wildebeests, join a murderous mob of meerkats, and become a destructive force with a swarm of locusts.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Travel to a spectacular land full of violent animals. Observe giraffes wielding their long necks as weapons, grab a meal with nature's flying undertakers, feel the force of the deadliest kick in nature, and form alliances with ill-tempered chimps.

programme.title: Wild Castles
programme.desc: Discover the world's largest castle carved into a cave. Predjama, in Slovenia, has provided protection not only for its Medieval human inhabitants, but also serves as a haven for the birds, boars, and mountain goats that live in the region.

programme.title: Wild Castles
programme.desc: Tour the marvelous Alhambra, a must-see fortress in Spain's Grenada region. Today this world heritage site acts as a refuge for the region's wildlife. With its many streams and fountains, Alhambra serves amphibian, fish, and bird alike.

programme.title: America's Wild Seasons
programme.desc: As fall sweeps across America and trees are set ablaze with colour, animals are faced with make-or-break decisions. Find out how bald eagles, beavers, and other creatures prepare for the colder, darker, and leaner months ahead.

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: From the vast, dry plains of the interior come some of Australia's most recognized imagery, such as the monolithic red rock of Uluru and the bounding red kangaroo. But how did the arid centre of the continent come to be?

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: Created by titanic forces and spanning 3,700 km along the eastern edge of Australia, the Great Dividing Range separates two very different worlds. Aerial footage and intimate studies reveal how species survive and thrive in this mountain home.

programme.title: Stormborn
programme.desc: Feel the howl of March storms as winter slowly releases its iron grip on the north Atlantic. Meet a family of playful otters, a lovelorn Arctic fox, and a reindeer herd determined to reach their calving grounds despite the fearsome weather.

programme.title: Stormborn
programme.desc: Experience the north Atlantic's intense, brief summer with its animal residents. Follow Arctic fox cubs learning to hunt for survival, an otter pup going solo for the first time, a mate-seeking puffin, and tiny reindeer taking their first steps.

programme.title: Stormborn
programme.desc: Welcome autumn to the north Atlantic, when its animals struggle to prepare for winter. Trace the grey seals' mating frenzy and witness the horrific price one seal pup must pay. Then see reindeer undertake a perilous swim along their migration path.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how one animal family's tragedy is another's holiday dinner as New Zealand's mainland and island creatures, including penguins, flightless birds, sea lions, and sharks, battle to feed and protect their young in this marine environment.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Find out which creatures survive and whose luck will run out as animal mothers and moms-to-be struggle with sweltering temperatures, lurking predators, mating season, and drought on a day that proves to be no holiday.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: North African white rhinos are teetering on the razor's edge of extinction. Follow the efforts of an international mission working to bring 4 of the last 8 surviving animals to Ol Pejeta, in an attempt to breed new hope for the species.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Strike out into the stunning landscapes surrounding Ol Pejeta. Get a closer look at Mount Kenya, the towering neighbour of the reserve. Take in a sunrise over the mountain, which is one of the most beautiful natural sights in all of Africa.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Grevy's zebra populations are declining rapidly, putting the skittish animals on the endangered list. See what Lewa Conservancy is doing to protect the species, and how partner groups from around the world are lending their expertise to help.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: Can conservationists keep the "100 Wild Islands" wild? How do migrating sandpipers live off the beach, anyways? This tour of Nova Scotia's coastline digs into the Bay of Fundy, the beaches of Burntcoat Head, and the surfers' paradise at Lawrencetown Beach.

programme.title: Rise Of The Machines (S2)
programme.desc: The helicopter battles some of the world's most extreme weather to rescue workers. Blowing this machine apart with CGI reveals the secrets to its success.

programme.desc: Martin and Liz explore Iceland to see if its volcanoes could spread global chaos in the future.

programme.title: Curse Of The Bermuda Triangle (S1)
programme.desc: Brand-new discoveries might finally explain the truth behind one of the Bermuda Triangle's most infamous disappearances.

programme.title: Ancient Unexplained Files (S1)
programme.desc: When a mass grave of mutilated skeletons is unearthed at the frontier of the Roman Empire, experts use advanced digital analysis.

programme.title: How The Universe Works (S6)
programme.desc: New discoveries reveal that sci-fi star systems with binary stars might be optimal places for alien life.

programme.title: You Have Been Warned (S4)
programme.desc: We're snowboarding in the clouds, quad bike riding with a koala, and looping a car in a sphere.
